qas.question: Why would one use hydrogen mixed with nitrogen?

answers.text: as a tracer gas for minute leak detection

qas.question: What industries can you find these applications?

answers.text: automotive, chemical, power generation, aerospace, and telecommunications

qas.question: How is hydrogen used as a food additive?

context: In more recent applications, hydrogen is used pure or mixed with nitrogen (sometimes called forming gas) <a0_0>as a tracer gas for minute leak detection<a0_0/>. Applications can be found in the <a1_0>automotive, chemical, power generation, aerospace, and telecommunications<a1_0/> industries. Hydrogen is an authorized food additive (E 949) that <a2_0>allows food package leak testing<a2_0/> among other anti-oxidizing properties.
